intro: Monopsis aspera, commonly known as the rough monopsis, is a rare and distinctive plant native to specific regions of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, hairy stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Monopsis aspera is considered a species of conservation concern.
